body:
@djw8605 thanks for the suggestion. I was able to make it work for [el7](https://travis-ci.org/efajardo/osg-test/jobs/275141037) but for [el6](https://travis-ci.org/efajardo/osg-test/jobs/275141034) it keeps failing.

https://travis-ci.org/efajardo/osg-test/jobs/275141035#L1198

```
FAIL: test_02_start_cvmfs (osgtest.tests.test_18_cvmfs.TestStartCvmfs)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/osgtest/library/osgunittest.py", line 165, in run
    testMethod()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/osgtest/tests/test_18_cvmfs.py", line 76, in test_02_start_cvmfs
    stdout, stderr, fail = core.check_system(command, 'Start cvmfs server')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/osgtest/library/core.py", line 263, in check_system
    assert status == exit, fail
AssertionError: Start cvmfs server
COMMAND: service autofs restart
EXIT STATUS: 1
STANDARD OUTPUT:
Loading autofs4: [FAILED]
STANDARD ERROR: [none]
```

@DrDaveD any idea on why autofs does not start inside travis on el6, but it does on el7?

Thanks,
